properties.entry: Bulk Communications
Data Validation
Powerline Carrier
Yukon System
Transmitter
Network Manager
N/A
Bad Message Type
The master station has received an unexpected response from the CCU.

This is a bulk communications error associated with a logic problem internal to the CCU or possibly an echo on the communication channel.
  • Attempt the command again
  • From Commander, remotely reset the CCU and attempt the command again
D Word Wrong length
The master station has received an invalid response from the targeted device.

This is a bulk communications error associated with the number of data packets received for a single communication. This error code is returned when the CCU receives too many or too few packets based on the request.
  • Attempt the command again
Parameter Out of Range
A parameter supplied in the command string is outside of its valid range.
A parameter supplied in the command string is outside of its valid range. Correct the invalid parameter and attempt the command again.
Parity Error
Checksum verification failed on communication between the master station and the targeted device.

This is a bulk communications error typically associated with systems using direct radio communications between the master station and a targeted device such as a CCU, RTU or dial up meter. Communication timing setup usually plays a role in troubleshooting this problem.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Using Commander, attempt a loop or scan on the targeted device to verify communications
    • If the loop or scan is successful,
      • Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below). If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support.
        1. Open Database Editor
        2. View -> Core
        3. Sort By-> Comm Channel
        4. Select and edit the appropriate channel
        5. Timings tab
    • If the loopback is not successful
      • Attempt to loop or scan another device using the same communications channel
Bad CCU Specification
The CCU address in the response does not match the address of the targeted CCU.

This is a bulk communications error that is commonly due to timing or buffering problems with communication equipment such as portservers or radios.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below) or the communication equipment itself. If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support.
    1. Open Database Editor
    2. View -> Core
    3. Sort By-> Comm Channel
    4. Select and edit the appropriate channel
    5. Timings tab
Word 1 NACK
The CCU received a partial response from the targeted device.

This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
  • Attempt communication on another route if available
    1. Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
    2. In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
    3. Attempt the command again
  • Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
Word 2 NACK
The CCU received a partial response from the targeted device.

This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
  • Attempt communication on another route if available
    1. Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
    2. In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
    3. Attempt the command again
  • Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
Word 3 NACK
The CCU received a partial response from the targeted device.

This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
  • Attempt communication on another route if available
    1. Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
    2. In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
    3. Attempt the command again
  • Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
Word 1 NACK Padded
The CCU did not receive a response from the targeted device.

This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Attempt communication on another route if available
    1. Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
    2. In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
    3. Attempt the command again
  • Attempt the same command with a different device on the original route
    • If the second device is successful
      • Verify the original device's serial number
      • Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
Word 2 NACK Padded
The CCU did not receive a response from the targeted device.

This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Attempt communication on another route if available
    1. Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
    2. In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
    3. Attempt the command again
  • Attempt the same command with a different device on the original route
    • If the second device is successful
      • Verify the original device's serial number
      • Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
Word 3 NACK Padded
The CCU did not receive a response from the targeted device.

This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Attempt communication on another route if available
    1. Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
    2. In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
    3. Attempt the command again
  • Attempt the same command with a different device on the original route
    • If the second device is successful
      • Verify the original device's serial number
      • Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
Timeout Reading from Port
The master station did not receive a response from the targeted device.

This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with a setup problem or possibly caused by a communications equipment failure
  • Attempt the command again
  • Attempt a loop or scan of another device using the same communications channel if available
    • If communication to the second device is successful, the error is probably caused by an equipment or setup problem with the original device.
      • Verify the targeted device's serial number and/or address
      • Verify the communication equipment (modem, phone line or radio) at the targeted device is working properly
    • If the communication to the second device is not successful, the error is probably caused by an equipment problem at the master station
      • Verify the communication equipment (modem, phone line or radio) at the master station is working properly
      • If the targeted device is a CCU, verify it is powered up and the selector is not switched to external
Sequence Reject Frame Received... Sequencing Adjusted
The response's sequence number does not match what was expected by the master station.

This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with invalid timing parameter's set at the master station. Another possible cause is a field visit to the CCU resulting in local communications being used. Upon setting the communications back to internal, the master station may receive this error on the first request due internal bookkeeping mismatches. The master station will automatically recovery from this internal mismatch.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below) or the communication equipment itself. If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support.
    1. Open Database Editor
    2. View -> Core
    3. Sort By-> Comm Channel
    4. Select and edit the appropriate channel
    5. Timings tab
Framing Error
The master station received an invalid header in the response from the targeted device.

This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with invalid timing parameters set at the master station. This particular code is returned when the first section of the response from the targeted device does not match what the master station was expecting.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below) or the communication equipment itself. If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support.
    1. Open Database Editor
    2. View -> Core
    3. Sort By-> Comm Channel
    4. Select and edit the appropriate channel
    5. Timings tab
Bad CRC on Message
Checksum verification failed on response from the targeted device.

This is a bulk communications error caused by an incomplete or corrupted response.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below) or the communication equipment itself. If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support.
    1. Open Database Editor
    2. View -> Core
    3. Sort By-> Comm Channel
    4. Select and edit the appropriate channel
    5. Timings tab
Bad HDLC UA Frame
The CCU did not respond correctly to a reset request.

This is a powerline carrier error associated with a logic problem internal to the CCU.
  • Attempt the command again
REQACK Flag set-- Frame Unexecutable
The CCU has rejected a request from the master station.

This is a bulk communications error often caused by a mismatch of bookkeeping between the master station and the CCU. Another possibility is a logic problem internal to the CCU.
  • Attempt the command again
  • From Commander, remotely reset the CCU and attempt the command again
  • If the problem persists, it may be due to a faulty logic card in the CCU. Replace the logic card or contact Technical Support.
Device ID not found
The device ID requested does not exist or is not loaded yet.
The devices may still be in process of being loaded by the servers, wait a few minutes and attempt the command again.
E-Word Received in Returned Message
The repeater did not receive a response from the end device.

This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Attempt communication on another route if available
    1. Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
    2. In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
    3. Attempt the command again
  • Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
    • If the second device is successful
      • Verify the original device's serial number
      • Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
No DCD on Return Message
The master station timed out while waiting for carrier detect on the communications channel.

This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with equipment failure or improperly configured communication channels
  • Attempt the command again
  • Verify carrier detect is necessary for this communication channel
    • If carrier detect is not necessary for this communication channel
      • Verify "Carrier Detect Wait" is unchecked on the communication channel
        1. Open Database Editor
        2. View -> Core
        3. Sort By-> Comm Channel
        4. Select and edit the appropriate channel
        5. "Carrier Detect Wait" checkbox on the General tab
  • Verify the communication equipment (modem, phone line or radio) at the master station is working properly
  • If the targeted device is a CCU, verify it is powered up and the selector is not switched to external
Error Reading from Port
The master station was unable to read from the communications channel.

This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with the inability to connect to or retrieve data from the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
  • Attempt the command again
  • If using a port server or terminal server, verify connectivity to the device containing the physical communication ports
Error Writing to Port
The master station was unable to write to the communications channel.

This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with the inability to connect to or write data to the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
  • Attempt the command again
  • If using a port server or terminal server, verify connectivity to the device containing the physical communication ports
DLC Read Timeout on CCU Queue Entry
The CCU did not receive a response from the targeted device on a queued request.

This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Attempt communication on another route if available
    1. Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
    2. In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
    3. Attempt the command again
  • Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
    • If the second device is successful
      • Verify the original device's serial number
      • Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
Route Failed on CCU Queue Entry
The CCU received a partial response from the targeted device on a queued request.

This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
  • Attempt communication on another route if available
    1. Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
    2. In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
    3. Attempt the command again
  • Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device
Operation Attempted on Inhibited Port
The targeted port is disabled or inhibited in the Yukon System.
This is a Yukon system message, the port is flagged as disabled in the Device Setup.
Operation Attempted on Inhibited Device
The targeted device is disabled or inhibited in the Yukon System.
This is a Yukon system message, the device is flagged as disabled in the Device Setup.
Error Dialing Up Remote
The master station was unable to communicate with the targeted device due to communication failure.

This is a bulk communications error typically associated with a failure to initialize the modem for dial-up.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Verify the modem is functioning properly
Wrong Unique Address Received
The CCU heard a response from a device other than the one it was targeting.

This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated either crosstalk or is preceded by a bulk communication error such as a timeout.
  • Attempt the command again
Error Connecting to Terminal Server
The master station was unable to connect to the communications channel.

This is a bulk communications error that is associated with the inability to connect to or initialize the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
  • Attempt the command again
  • Verify connectivity to the device (terminal server) containing the physical communication ports
Error Writing to Terminal Server
The master station was unable to write to the communications channel.

This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with the inability to connect to or send data to the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
  • Attempt the command again
  • Verify connectivity to the device (terminal server) containing the physical communication ports
Error Reading from Terminal Server
The master station was unable to read from the communications channel.

This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with the inability to connect to retrieve data from the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
  • Attempt the command again
  • Verify connectivity to the device (terminal server) containing the physical communication ports
Address Does Not Match Expected Value
The CCU heard a response from a device other than the one it was targeting.

This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated either crosstalk or is preceded by a bulk communication error such as a timeout.
  • Attempt the command again
Bad Data Buffer for IED
The powerline carrier device was unable to communicate to the connected IED.

This is a powerline carrier error that is associated with using a powerline carrier device to query data from another intelligent device on the line. The error is returned when the carrier device is unable to communicate with the polyphase meter or other end device.
  • Attempt the command again
  • If possible, verify the physical connection between the carrier device and the IED
Missing Required Configuration Entry
The device was unable to complete the requested command.

This is a Yukon system error that is associated with using MCT device configuration information. The error is returned when the MCT device does not have configuration information stored already in the database. An attempt to retrieve the configuration information should be should be made.
  • Attempt the command again
  • If possible, verify the physical connection between the carrier device and the IED
Bad Nexus Specification
A connection to the TCP/IP device could not be established or a current connection failed.

• Attempt the command again
  • Confirm communication with TCP/IP devices by 'pinging' the IP address of the devices. Check the setup of all devices found unreachable.
  • Confirm the Yukon configuration of the TCP/IP device and communications port are correct.
  • Confirm the device's configuration is correct.
  • Physically inspect any unreachable devices for hardware issues.
  • Contact third parties to confirm operation of network.
Error Writing to Port
A connection to the TCP/IP device could not be established or a current connection failed.

• Attempt the command again
  • Confirm communication with TCP/IP devices by 'pinging' the IP address of the devices. Check the setup of all devices found unreachable.
  • Confirm the Yukon configuration of the TCP/IP device and communications port are correct.
  • Confirm the device's configuration is correct.
  • Physically inspect any unreachable devices for hardware issues.
  • Contact third parties to confirm operation of network.
Bad BCH
Checksum verification failed on the response from the end device.

This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
  • Attempt the command again
  • Attempt communication on another route if available
    1. Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
    2. In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
    3. Attempt the command again
  • Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
  • Attempt the command on the original device and verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation
NoMethod or invalid command.
The command is incorrect or not supported by this device type.

• Verify the command string syntax is valid.
  • The firmware for this device may not support this operation.
MACS timed out on this message
MACS timed out on this message.

MACS did not hear anything back from Porter within the script timeout (default 15 minutes).
  • Porter's work queue may be overloaded with other requests. You may need to adjust script start times and/or increase the script timeout.
The freeze check bit in the frozen reading does not match the last recorded freeze sent to the device.
The freeze check bit in the frozen reading does not match the last recorded freeze sent to the device.

This is a data validation error associated with the freeze check bit retrieved from the device not matching the value expected by the master station.
  • Send the expected freeze command and attempt the command again
    1. Using Commander, resend the expected freeze.
    2. Attempt the command again
The frozen peak timestamp is outside of the expected range.
Verification of the frozen peak's timestamp as retrieved from the device has failed.

This is a data validation error associated with the frozen peak demand's timestamp falling outside the range expected by the master station. This range is defined as greater than the last frozen peak demand reading archived in the database and less than the timestamp of the most recent freeze command sent to the device. This error typically occurs if the device missed an attempted freeze of the registers.
  • Send the expected freeze command and attempt the command again
    1. Using Commander, resend the expected freeze.
    2. Attempt the command again
The freeze counter is less than the expected value.
Verification of the freeze counter has failed. Device did not receive one or more of the last Freeze commands.
The last recorded freeze count (in Yukon) for the device does not match the current count returned from the device. This indicates a freeze command was not received by the device.
Invalid data was received for one or more data points.
Invalid data was received for one or more data points.
There is no record of the last freeze sent to this device.
There is no record of the last freeze sent to this device.
Invalid time returned OR time outside of requested range - retry.
The setup validation data returned by the meter did not match the expected value. The device did not hear the setup command.
The meter did not receive the setup command for the read. Attempt the read again.
Invalid channel returned by daily read.
The setup validation data returned by the meter did not match the expected value. The device did not hear the setup command.
The meter did not receive the setup command for the read. Attempt the read again.
Invalid or insufficient device SSPEC revision.
The meter does not support the requested command.
Please verify the SSPEC supports the requested command. Execute 'getconfig model' to retrieve the SSPEC revision.
Verification of device SSPEC revision is required.
Verification of device SSPEC revision is required.
Execute 'getconfig model' to verify the device SSPEC revision.
Invalid future data rejected
Data was rejected because its timestamp was more than a year in the future.
Verify the time settings in the remote device.
Port is not initialized
The request has been received, but may be delayed because the port is not initialized. Bulk communication channel may be experiencing connection difficulties.
Verify the bulk communication channel is functioning properly.
Daily read request already in progress
The daily read request is already in progress.
The daily read request is already in progress with another daily read request. Only one daily read can be in progress at a time. Wait for a moment and attempt the command again.
No connection to device
Yukon is unable to establish a connection with the device.
Verify the device's connection parameters.
No disconnect configured on this device
The device does not have a disconnect to be operated on.
Verify there is a disconnect configured in the Device Setup.
Transmitter is overheating
The request was denied because the PLC transmitter is overheating.
Hardware Protection Mode.
Command requires channel configuration to continue.
In order to collect load profile, the system needs to retrieve the channel setup information.
The system will attempt to collect the required configuration data automatically. Retry the command.
No node in Network Manager.
There isn't a node in Network Manager which is currently associated with this device in Yukon.
Use Network Manager to see if this meter exists and is known to be paired with any RF nodes.
There is no RF gateway associated with the RF node.
There isn't a gateway in Network Manager which is currently associated with this node.
Use Network Manager to see which RF gateway is associated with the RF node in question, if any.
There was an error while processing the request.
An unexpected Network Manager error has occurred.
Check Network Manager server logs to identify the root cause of the failure.
Timeout
Request timed out
Check Yukon Logs for errors
Invalid Action for Device Type.
This action cannot be performed on this device type.
N/A
Successful Read
N/A
Troubleshooting tips for this error code are not available at this time
Troubleshooting tips for this error code are not available at this time
